reviews.text: 11:30 AM. Rice and peas not ready till 12:00 . White rice chowy and cold. Fried chicken dried up from overnight. Food not hot. Currygoat gravy not enough for the tonload of old chow rice. Charged $18 for small fry chicken lunch . The smallest leg piece. Wicked. Worthless. Thief. Attitude. .  Do not buy anything at Nicky's.

I usually purchase from this establishment and truly enjoy the food. However, during my last Uber Eats order, I did not receive the plantains I had ordered. I called at the time, and the owner was very apologetic, assuring me that with my next order I could inform the team and receive the missing item.

Today, 09/20/25 at 1:31 PM, I placed another order (Order #94FD7)  and contacted the establishment to relay the previous conversation with the owner. Unfortunately, the woman who answered the phone responded with attitude, even uttering ‚Äújeez‚Äù before hanging up.

While I do love your food, I kindly urge you to provide your staff with proper customer service training. This experience was very disappointing.

Food is usually pretty good but lately they don‚Äôt have plantain with the food like they usually do and my oxtails today weren‚Äôt soft like it usually is. Last time my goat was a little salty. I don‚Äôt know if they have a new cook.
Thr chicken Roti is super delicious the meat was so tender. üòã
I don‚Äôt know but the rice been off lately! ü§Æ‚Ä¶

I had the pleasure of dining at this fantastic Jamaican restaurant in Sudbury, and I am already planning my next visit! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere, complete with the vibrant colors and music that transport you straight to the heart of Jamaica. The food was absolutely incredible ‚Äì the jerk chicken had the perfect balance of spice, and the curry goat was rich, tender, and full of flavor. The portions were generous, and everything tasted so fresh. The staff was friendly and attentive, making sure we felt right at home. If you're craving authentic Jamaican cuisine in Sudbury, this is the place to go. I can't recommend it enough

Great job Nicky!
Best soup in Brooklyn
pleasant  atmosphere
Never open when they say they are open

The food is excellent, authentic Jamaican cuisine. Very tasty and you get a good amount in each serving.

There is a wide variety of the usual Jamaican options for lunch and dinner.

The prices are a touch pricey but not out of reach.

The outside of the premises need to be cleaned up and organized in a more tidy, inviting and pleasant manner.

Same with the inside. It‚Äôs a bit disorganized. They are not making full use of the space and much more can be done.

The staff is very friendly, especially the lady with the pleasant smile.
Good food service near road transportation parking .

I ordered the curry chicken with white rice. The chicken was very well seasoned and juicy and fell right off the bones. I even chewed on the bones which had flavor. The rice was a bit watery but it didn‚Äôt take away from the flavor of the dish. I ordered a small and they were super generous with their portion sizes. Additional points for it being a local business. Will definitely recommend if you‚Äôre in the Canarsie area.

Food gave me food poisoning stew chicken rice n peas not so much food poisoning but my stomach was turning after I ate it badly didn‚Äôt throw up though. The gravy was so thick.Oxtail was rough. 40-50$ for 2 plates not the best impression of this restaurant n I don‚Äôt even ever wrote reviews but this making my stomach hurt so I have to. Good service bad food.

The food at Nicky's is consistently delicious.   The service is on point with a smile.

It was horrible to open food to see just meat and rice ! I‚Äôm not a dog I like to see veggies or salad with my food ! Most restaurants give this to you automatically, but for some reason with this on e you have to ask ! I couldn‚Äôt eat the food totally turned off by just meat and rice

In my opinion it is the best of New York City and perhaps even broader than that, Jamaican jerk chicken dish. I am not Jamaican but eating Jamaican food for over 20 years from various Jamaican food establishments and nothing can match it. When I visit Jamaica (the country) I was on a quest go find better jerk chicken and guess what none can beat Nicky‚Äôs cooking. It is cooked all through to the bones and is melting in a mouth. Few years ago I ask Nick what is your secret? He just smiled and said if I‚Äôll tell you I‚Äôll have to kill you.

So far their stew peas is my go to.

Had curry chicken the other night and it was a but fresh (lacking salt) and the rice was mushy. So I won't do that again

Their red bean soup with beef and pigtail is AMAZING. I could eat it all day.
On the other hand, I bought a large oxtail with rice and peas for $18 and received only FOUR mediocre pieces of oxtail. Are they serious?

I wish they would take customer reviews and feedback seriously.

Food is mediocre. Poor customer service. Not really sure why the male working at the counter completely ignored a patron after he said good morning, or why he had an attitude while taking my order... Cornmeal porridge had the consistency of broth..no thank you for the food or west Indian hospitality..Try other places instead.

One of my favorites. The menu can vary depending on availability of ingredients.

Their business is mostly take-out, but they have some tables and we eat in and take out.

My Jamaican friends say the food reminds them of back home.
Run by nice people well like by the community.

Some dishes can be spicy, some are mild, as is typical of Jamaican cuisine, but something for everybody.

Family owned, great tasting food, they don‚Äôt skimp you on the portions, especially with the oxtail. They beat many of the other bigger named ‚ÄúJamaican‚Äù restaurants. I‚Äôve surveyed almost all.

And the actual Nicky is a beautiful melanated lady.

Love the food BUT the young lady in the front has a attitude like no other I don't understand people come to your establishment you should have a pleasant attitude not a nasty attitude.. Cutting your eyes like you're still in high school...‚Ä¶

The food is good and delivery is great, except packaging is horrible, I ordered quite a few times, and the containers were either upside down or sideways, all the gravy leakes out, so the actual contents are very dry, which leads to no flavor.

Extremely poor customer service. Visited 11/24/19 for the first time and definitely the last. The girl at the front rooled her eyes as if I'm being a bother by asking what's on the breakfast menu. Don't waste your time or $$.
